title: RealSyn: An Effective and Scalable Multimodal Interleaved Document Transformation Paradigm
author: Tiancheng Gu (The University of Sydney), Kaicheng Yang (DeepGlint), Chaoyi Zhang (The University of Sydney), Yin Xie (DeepGlint), Xiang An (DeepGlint), Ziyong Feng (DeepGlint), Dongnan Liu (The University of Sydney), Weidong Cai (The University of Sydney), Jiankang Deng (Imperial College London)
relevance_why: The paper's techniques for multimodal document transformation and the creation of datasets could inspire novel approaches for audio-visual or text-audio integration tasks in Haohe Liu's work.
background: Transforming interleaved image-text documents into distinct image-text pairs to leverage multimodal data for improved vision-language representation learning.
contribution: This paper introduces a Real-World Data Extraction pipeline and a framework to generate a large-scale dataset *RealSyn* to enhance vision-language knowledge transfer.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing datasets typically rely on filtered internet sources or paired data, which may lack diversity and real-world relevance.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work introduces hierarchical retrieval methods and semantic augmented generation to create rich multimodal datasets that facilitate better representation learning.

key_innovation: The integration of real and synthetic text through a robust hierarchical retrieval system, allowing for scalable data generation from non-paired multimodal documents.
real_world_impact: The developed dataset and methods can potentially enhance cross-modal systems in various applications like automated content creation, multimedia understanding, and human-computer interaction.
limitations: The paper mentions scarcity in specific data distributions which may hinder model performance in certain categories.

new_terms.multimodal: **Multimodal** refers to the integration of multiple types of data, such as text, image, and audio, to enhance learning and understanding.
new_terms.semantic augmented generation: **Semantic augmented generation** is the process of creating new data or textual descriptions that faithfully represent and enhance the meaning of existing content.

open_sourcing: The *RealSyn* dataset and pretrained model weights are available at https://github.com/deepglint/RealSyn.
